episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the peculiar voice of Abraham Lincoln, ancient Scottish crannogs, the fascinating world of lichens, and the authentication process for sneakers on eBay.

facts.fact: It would take people around 10 minutes to adjust to the way Abraham Lincoln sounded before they could enjoy his speeches.
5,000 years ago, Scots built houses by dropping huge piles of stones to the bottom of locks and building their home on top of them.

The only known species of marine lichen was discovered by a person named Ivan Lam, whose work often acknowledged the help of a Miss Elkie Mackenzie, but that turned out to be one in the same person as Lam later transitioned and took that name.
eBay employs staff whose job includes sniffing trainers.
